intro: Cassebeeria tomentella, commonly known as the woolly cassie, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is distinguished by its dense, velvety grayish-white pubescence that covers its stems and leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a spurred structure at the base of the petals. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest understory environments.
